entry.title: Digitized "Egyptological" works of Athanasius Kircher
entry.content:
Digitized "Egyptological" works of Athanasius Kircher
  •  Kircher, Athanasius Athanasii Kircheri ... Turris Babel sive archontologia: qua primo priscorum post diluvium hominum vita, mores rerumque gestarum magnitudo, secundo turris fabrica civitatumque exstructio, confusio linguarum & inde gentium transmigrationis, cum principalium inde enatorum idiomatum historia, multiplici eruditione describuntur & explicantur Amsterdam, 1679
  • Mundus subterraneus, in XII libros digestus: quo divinum subterrestris mundi opificium, mira ergasteriorum naturae in eo distributio ... universae denique naturae maiestatis & divitiae summa rerum varietate exponuntur ...  (1678) by Athanasius Kircher.
    • Vol. 1
    • Vol. 2
  • Oedipus Aegyptiacus (1652-4) by Athanasius Kircher.
    • Vol.I, Vol.II, Vol.III on Google Books â€“ (NB: These are Google scans so under a non-commercial license)
    • ECHO, European Cultural Heritage Online
  • Obeliscus Pamphilius (1650) by Athanasius Kircher.
    • Internet Archive
  • Sphinx Mystagoga (1676) by Athanasius Kircher.
    • Herzog August Bibliothek
     A large collection of letters to Kircher, the Athanasius Kircher Correspondence Project, is hosted by the Stanford University Libraries and now available online via Luna Insight software. See also the Institute and Museum of the History of Science (Florence, Italy) Kircher Correspondence Project webpage for background and details of this project.

    Other digitized scholarship of Kircher is listed in the entry Athanasius Kircher in Wikipedia.

    Please comment if you know of more to be included here.
